title: ‘I just feel numb’: Inside the Patriots’ locker room after a crushing Super Bowl defeat
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost Super Bowl LX 29-13 to Seattle Seahawks, with emotions running high in the locker room post-game.
Cornerback Charles Woods and safety Craig Woodson expressed disappointment, with Woodson leading the team with 10 tackles.
Quarterback Drake Maye played through a shoulder injury, impacting the Patriots' offensive performance in the game.

title: The 2025 Patriots season was a success. You can still feel sick about its ending.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seattle Seahawks with a score of 29-13.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel expressed pride but disappointment after the team's Super Bowl loss.
Quarterback Drake Maye's performance was hindered by the offensive line issues, with six sacks against him.

title: A 1788 Rhode Island home that houses the ‘oldest gingerbread ovens in America’ for $754k
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: The 1788 home at 1724 South Road in Kingston, Rhode Island, features America's oldest gingerbread ovens.
The 1,803-square-foot property, known as the 'Gem at Little Rest,' is listed for sale at $754,000.
Current owners Chris and Emily England modernized the home's systems while preserving its historical features.

title: Drake Maye admits he needed pain-killing shot for shoulder injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye received a pain-killing injection for his right shoulder before Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.
Maye first injured his shoulder during the AFC Championship Game against the Denver Broncos on January 25.
In Super Bowl LX, Maye completed 27 of 43 passes for 295 yards, with two touchdowns, two interceptions, and a lost fumble.

title: What Mike Vrabel had to say about the Patriots after Super Bowl LX loss
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots coach, refused to solely blame QB Drake Maye for the Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Vrabel emphasized teamwork and execution while recognizing the Seahawks as a strong team after the 29-13 defeat.
Vrabel plans to rebuild for next season, focusing on roster improvements and learning from the championship game experience.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson excelled defensively for the Patriots despite a loss in Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled, allowing six sacks and forcing the team to abandon the run game.
Seahawks' Kenneth Walker III won Super Bowl MVP, exploiting the Patriots' defense for significant rushing gains.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye expressed regret after the Patriots' 29-13 loss to the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Seattle's defense pressured Maye, resulting in six sacks and three costly turnovers contributing to the Patriots' defeat.
Despite the loss, Patriots quarterback Drake Maye praised his teammates and expressed optimism for the team's future.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny performed a joyful Super Bowl 60 halftime show in Santa Clara, highlighting Latin culture and music.
The show featured guests Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin, and a medley of Bad Bunny's hits at Levi’s Stadium.
Despite prior criticism, the performance focused on unity and love, concluding with a positive message on the Jumbotron.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Super Bowl LX attracted celebrities like Jay-Z, Lady Gaga, Tom Brady, and Peyton Manning at Levi’s Stadium, Santa Clara.
Bad Bunny, Cardi B, and Karol G performed at halftime, joined by pop star Lady Gaga.
Attendees included actors Robert Downey Jr., Adam Sandler, musicians Justin Bieber, and Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn against a fake Instagram account portraying a female trooper with 100,000 followers.
The account, named 'Sarita', displays images of a woman in a police uniform linking to an OnlyFans account.
The impersonation uses AI-generated content, also mimicking a Santa Monica officer, and was reported to social media platforms.
